questions.text: This Irish author and poet's life story was the basis for the film, 'My Left Foot' ?
questions.explanation:
Christy Brown.

	He was born with crippling cerebral palsy, and his only usable limb was his left foot. He wrote the best seller, 'Down All the Days' in 1970.

questions.text: This American cartoonist created the very popular comic strip, 'Little Orphan Annie' in 1924 ?
questions.explanation:
Harold Lincoln Gray.

	The strip was syndicated until 1968.

questions.text: This 'Princely' movie was released in 1984. It was 'Revolutionary' if you know what I mean. What was it called ?
questions.explanation:
Purple Rain.

	All of these 'purple' titles were actual movies... not all were big hits though.

questions.text: This 'Blue' Canadian person was a vaudeville star, comedian and dancer, who appeared in the film, 'It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World'. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Ben Blue.

	Benjamin Berstein was Ben's less colorful real name.

questions.text: This color is the real first name of singer Marie Osmond ?
questions.explanation:
Olive.

	Born in 1959, in Ogden, Utah, she had a hit with the colorful 'Paper Roses'.

questions.text: This educator might be found in the hall with a candlestick, or maybe even in the study with the wrench?
questions.explanation:
Professor Plum.

	Clue was made into a movie in 1985 and it was filmed with three different endings.

questions.text: American author Stephen Crane wrote this 'colorful' novel in 1895 ?
options: The Green Mold on My Baked Alaska
questions.explanation:
The Red Badge of Courage.

	His novel was made into a movie, starring Audie Murphy.

questions.text: 'Easy Rider' and 'Five Easy Pieces' were two films this actress starred in ?
questions.explanation:
Karen Black.

	She was born Karen Blanche Ziegler in 1942 in Park Ridge, Illinois.

questions.text: This English guitarist was in the original 1967 Fleetwood Mac band ?
questions.explanation:
Peter Green.

	Born in London, Peter's troubled history resulted in institutionalization.

questions.text: This Australian author, known for 'The Eye of the Storm', won the Nobel Prize in 1973? Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Patrick Victor Martindale White.

	All except Wink Martindale White, are authors. E.B.White wrote 'Stuart Little' and 'Charlotte's Web'. Terence Hanbury White wrote 'The Sword in the Stone'.
